# GENERAL NOTES
1\. THIS DRAWING IS PREPARED AND SUGGESTED FOR ITS PURPOSE AS
A REFERENCE.
2\. TENDERER SHALL PREPARE AND SUBMIT THE DRAWING BASED ON
HIS OWN SYSTEM DESIGN CONCEPT.
3\. THE INSTRUMENT LEGEND IS BASED ON ISA STANDARD 5.1,
FOR FURTHER DETAILS AND CLARIFICATION, REFER TO ISA STANDARD.
4\. ANY FIRST LETTER MAY BE MODIFIED BY THE FOLLOWING LETTERS:
J - SCAN
( AJl - SCANNING ANALYZER INDICATOR )
Q - INTEGRATE OR TOTALIZER ( FQI - FLOW INTEGRATING INDICATOR )
5\. A CONTROL OR SENSING DEVICE OR RELAY HAVING A DISPLAY FUNCTION
SHOULD HAVE THE APPROPRIATE DISPLAY LETTERS ADDED AFTER THE
MEASURED VARIABLE DESIGNATION. E.G. AIK DESIGNATES ANALYSIS
INDICATING CONTROL STATION.
6\. HIGH-HIGH ALARMS HAVE ( )AHH.
LOW-LOW ALARMS HAVE (, JALL.
HIGH-LOW ALARMS HAVE ( )AHL
IN INSTRUMENT CIRCLE, E.G.
LAHH - DESIGNATES HIGH-HIGH LEVEL ALARM
LALL - DESIGNATES LOW-LOW LEVEL ALARM
LAHL - DESIGNATES HIGH-LOW LEVEL ALARM
7\. THE LETTER Z WHICH FOLLOWS A MEASURED VARIABLE REPRESENTS
FINAL DEVICES OTHER THAN CONTROL VALVES SUCH AS HYDRAULIC
COUPLINGS, VARIABLE SPEED DRIVE, ACTUATOR, ETC.
8\. THE LETTERS H. HH. L. LL AND HL ARE ADDED TO THE MEASURED
VARIABLES FOR HIGH, HIGH-HIGH, LOW, LOW-LOW AND HIGH-LOW
RESPECTIVELY, AS FOR ALARMS AND INTERLOCK.
9\. A TEST POINT IS A PROCESS CONNECTION TO WHICH NO INSTRUMENT
IS PERMANENTLY CONNECTED, BUT WHICH IS INTENDED FOR TEMPORARY.
PERMANENILT CONNECTCONNECTION INSTRUMENTIN TEMPORA
INTERMITTENT, OR FUTURE CONNECTION OF AN INSTRUMENT.
\- PRESSURE POINT
AP - DESIGNATES ANAL VEJE AYNI - DESIGNATES THERMOWELL
ANALYSIS
TO DESIGNATE PATS POINT AW - DESIGNATES SAMPLE NOZZLE
TP - DESIGNATES TEMPERATURE POINT
E
10\. USER'S CHOICE SUCCEEDING LETTER N AND FIRST LETTER O ARE FOR
UNLISTED MEANINGS THAT WILL BE USED REPITITIVELY ON A PARTICULAR
PROJECT. THE MEANINGS WILL BE DEFINED ONLY ONCE FOR THAT
PROJECT AND HAVE ONE AND ONLY ONE MEANING AS THE FIRST LETTER
AND ANOTHER SINGLE MEANING AS THE SUCCEEDING LETTER.
11\. THE LETTER X IS FOR UNLISTED MEANINGS THAT WILL BE USED ONLY
ONCE OR TO A LIMITED EXTENT. IT MAY HAVE ANY NUMBER OF MEANINGS
AS AFIRST LETTER AND ANT NUMBER OF MEANINGS AS A SUCCEEDING
LETTER, EXCEPT FOR ITS USE WITH DISTINCTIVE SYMBOLS, THE
MEANINGS WILL BE DEFINED OUTSIDE THE INSTRUMENT CIRCLE.
12\. THE LETTER A IS USED FOR ANALYSIS VARIABLES. THE FOLLOWING
TERMS MAY BE PLACED OUTSIDE THE INSTRUMENT CIRCLE OF A LOOP
TO DENOTE THE SPECIFIC VARIABLES:
0
\- CHLORIDE
CO - CARBON MONOXIDE
02
\- GASEOUS OXYGEN
COMB - COMBUSTIBLE
5102
H2
No
\- SODIUM
502 - SULPHUR DIOXIDE
NOx - NITROGEN OXIDES
CL2 - CHLORINE
\- LOCAL SAMPLE
CC - CATION CONDUCTIVITY
SC
\- SPECIFIC CONDUCTIVITY
13\. FO - DESIGNATES FLOW RESTRICTION ORIFICE
FF - DESIGNATES FLOW RATIO
FFC - DESIGNATES FLOW RATIO CONTROLLER
14\. IN CASE OF MULTI-FUNCTION INSTRUMENT, SUCCEEDING LETTERS
SHALL BE ADDED.
15\. THE TYPE OF INSTRUMENT MAY BE NAMED OUTSIDE THE INSTRUMENT
CIRCLE, E.G. MAGNETIC FLOW METER, MASS FLOW METER, FLOW SIGHT
GLASS.
16\. THE UPPER INSTRUMENT LEAD LINE IS OMITTED IF LEVEL IS
MEASURED BY PRESSURE INSTEAD OF DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE.
17\. A DOUBLE SOLENOID VALVE IS DRAWN WITH TWO SINGLE SOLENOIDS.
18\. VALVE BODY PORTS THAT ARE CLOSED IN NORMAL OPERATION ARE
BLACKENED. THE PORT THAT IS TO BE CLOSED WHEN THE STATE CHANGES
TO OFF-NORMAL WILL CONTAIN A DOT. THE OPERATING CONDITION SHOWN
FOR ALL VALVE BODIES CORRESPONDS TO FULL LOAD OR NORMAL
OPERATION REGARDLESS OF THE TYPE OF ACTUATOR OR WHETHER THE
ACTUATOR IS ENERGIZED OR DE-ENERGIZED DURING THIS MODE OF
OPERATION.
19\. A HAND CONTROL VALVE (HVAC) IS A HAND-ACTUATED VALVE
THAT EITHER MODULATES A PROCESS STREAM OR IS USED
AS AN INSTRUMENT DEVICE.
C
20\. INSTRUMENT TAGGING TO BE IN ACCORDANCE WITH "IDENTIFICATION
PROCEDURE OF INSTRUMENTATION AND DISTRIBUTED CONTROL SYSTEM I/O*
21\. ALL INSTRUMENT ROOT VALVES SHALL BE INCLUDED IN PIPING OR
EQUIPMENT SUPPLIER'S SCOPE.
22\. ALL CONTROL VALVES SHALL BE PROVIDED WITH A POSITION TRANSMITTER
AND A LEVEL SWITCH.
23\. ALL MOTORIZED VALVES SHALL BE PROVIDED WITH THE FOLLOWING ACCESSORIES.
ON/OFF UVIT SWITCH
\- FOR INCHING : LIVIT SWITCH AND POSITION TRANSMITTER.
\- FOR CONTROL : POSITION TRANSMITTER
